rounds.event: Second Italo-Ethiopian War: Italy leaves the League of Nations.
births: Jim Harrison, American novelist, essayist, and poet
deaths: Jaan Anvelt, Estonian theorist and politician
Hugh Thackeray Turner, English architect and painter

rounds.event: World War II: Germany and Italy declare war on the United States, following the Americans' declaration of war on the Empire of Japan in the wake of the attack on Pearl Harbor. The United States, in turn, declares war on them.
births: Max Baucus, American lawyer, politician, and diplomat, 11th United States Ambassador to China
J. P. Parisé, Canadian ice hockey player, coach, and manager
Rogier van Otterloo, Dutch conductor and composer
deaths: John Gillespie Magee, Jr., American pilot and poet
Émile Picard, French mathematician and academic

rounds.event: At least 125 people are killed and up to 200 injured in bombings in the Alawite village of Aqrab, Syria.
deaths: Galina Vishnevskaya, Russian soprano and actress
Mendel Weinbach, Polish-Israeli rabbi and scholar
Ravi Shankar, Indian-American sitar player and composer

rounds.event: Insurgency in the Maghreb: Two car bombs explode in Algiers, Algeria, one near the Supreme Constitutional Court and the other near the offices of the United Nations.

Felipe Calderón, the President of Mexico, launches a military-led offensive to put down the drug cartel violence in the state of Michoacán. This effort is often regarded as the first event in the Mexican Drug War.
